The "Property Value" entities identified in the paragraph are "good solubility," "three solubilizing n-dodecyl groups," "chloroform," "THF," and "toluene." These entities are directly related to the properties or characteristics of the substance being discussed in the paragraph.

After reviewing the entities identified in the previous answer, I have removed "chloroform," "THF," and "toluene" as they do not clearly refer to the value of a material property. Instead, they are examples of common organic solvents in which the substance with "good solubility" and "three solubilizing n-dodecyl groups" can dissolve.

The remaining entities, "good solubility" and "three solubilizing n-dodecyl groups," are the only ones that clearly refer to the value of a material property. "Good solubility" describes the ability of a substance to dissolve in a solvent, while "three solubilizing n-dodecyl groups" refers to a chemical structure that enhances the solubility of a substance.
